Photo by Unsplash

This week my thoughts are with all of those affected by the attacks in Belgium.

However I still wanted to share the latest goings on from the one of the most awesome communities you’ll find in WordPress or anywhere else, that’s all of you in the Genesis community of course.

As always, thanks for stopping by, and wishing you and all your family a safe and happy Easter.

Themes

It seems like barely a week goes by these days without a new theme release over at StudioPress and this week is no different with the warm Interior Pro theme now available (designed by Ash Schweitzer).

We're happy to Introduce our inviting new theme: Interior Pro #genesiswphttps://t.co/2A2WNwlykl pic.twitter.com/JF9gQLyb99

— StudioPress (@studiopress) March 23, 2016

Ren V. launches a new theme, Summation.

Just released my new #GenesisWP child theme, Summation. Have look! https://t.co/S8PEgYdzgM

— Ren V. (@CLE_Ren) March 19, 2016

The prolific Wes Straham with a new theme called Ambition over at Appfinite.

The Ambition Theme is now available for the Genesis Framework – https://t.co/zA116FWV7f

Let me know what you think!#genesiswp #wordpress

— Wes Straham (@WesStraham) March 23, 2016

One of my favourite Genesis designers, Frank over at WP Studio, has a great looking theme tease.

Playing with a redesign of the Plastic Theme https://t.co/PbREvrETyG #genesiswp #wp #wordpress

— WPStudio (@wpstudiowp) March 23, 2016

Jesse Petersen is ending his pre-order deal for his GenesisThe.me project today (Friday 25 March)…

What #mobilefirst should look like. Pre-order deal for @_GenesisTheme ends Friday #genesiswp https://t.co/dU95XkdnYy pic.twitter.com/UYGV3YKXQB

— Jesse Ⓦ Petersen (@jpetersen) March 21, 2016

…with launch expected soon.

We are REALLY close to launching! Just testing remaining. Pre-launch deals: https://t.co/3letR4eTP5 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/Usk9K2jZF5

— GenesisThe.me (@_GenesisTheme) March 21, 2016

Showcase

Rainmaker’s podcast network website got a sweet redesign (from Rafal Tomal, I believe!) check it out at rainmaker.fm

Rainmaker.FM got a redesign today. Check it out. #genesiswp #RainmakerPlatform

— Rafal Tomal (@RafalTomal) March 18, 2016

A stellar site from IdeaBox Creations for rvncreative.com

Our team @helloideabox completed a beautiful PSD to #Genesiswp site – https://t.co/nYkl9F5QwW

— Puneet Sahalot (@psahalot) March 19, 2016

Really nice site from Quicy Zikmund for encounterevansville.com

Launched a new church site last night using Aspire Pro and lots of custom post type goodness. #genesiswp https://t.co/lKkESfJvuv

— Quincy Zikmund (@quincyzikmund) March 21, 2016

Shaan Nicol with a new site for bowlah.com

I don’t usually use pre-built #genesiswp child themes, but this was an exception, turned out ok for a small site pic.twitter.com/vSvgqxgvi8

— ChillyBin Web Design (@chillybindesign) March 21, 2016

Cami MacNamara with a new site based on the Digital Pro theme for stoprenting.today

A new site using Digital Pro @studiopress #genesiswp https://t.co/XXtX59vgPv Sometimes simple is all you need! pic.twitter.com/G984ETI45R

— Cami MacNamara (@webcami) March 22, 2016

I’m a big fan of JT Grauke’s Showcase theme (released recently over at StudioPress) and it’s great to see it being used by Spinifex Media on this site for penguinaccounts.com.au

New #genesiswp site launch! Shout out to @jtgrauke for the excellent Showcase theme. https://t.co/mJ3qWfEryx

— Spinifex Media (@spnfxmedia) March 22, 2016

Best of the rest

Continuing the push on accessibility, Rafal Tomal reveals that three of Rainmaker’s biggest sites will all be accessible soon.

@GaryJ @cjkoepke I’m going to update https://t.co/IRH42zXJJf, https://t.co/gpRJdE4137 and rainmaker.fm all at once and make them accessible.

— Rafal Tomal (@RafalTomal) March 18, 2016

Know The Code publishes a quick start guide for becoming a more awesome developer (including using Genesis, of course) and reveals that “April 2016 will be Genesis month” on knowthecode.io

Handy guide to get you on the path to becoming a #MoreAwesomeDeveloper https://t.co/ZzUl56kDCq #WordPress #GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/e2JOIj72Nh

— Know The Code (@KnowTheCodePro) March 22, 2016

Nice article from Bill Erickson on how to handle shortcodes in an altogether more elegant way on your next client project.

If you use shortcodes, improve the UX using Shortcake. https://t.co/0G8WYC2WTb

— Bill Erickson (@BillErickson) March 23, 2016

Ren V. with a quick snippet for enabling the Genesis Scripts meta box on custom post types.

Need to add support for #GenesisWP Scripts to custom post types? https://t.co/axODDrQJJY

— Ren V. (@CLE_Ren) March 24, 2016

Lauren over at Restored 316 has got two tutorials for you, first, how to set a featured image for your categories and add it into a widget space…

How to set a featured image for your categories and add it into a widget space. #genesiswp https://t.co/v9yotLRJt9 pic.twitter.com/LYwAJv9RH4

— Lauren Gaige (@restored316) March 23, 2016

…and what to do when you get the white screen of death in WordPress.

Avoid the panic! What do do when you get the white screen of death: #wordpress #genesiswp https://t.co/nD1qbPBjam

— Lauren Gaige (@restored316) March 21, 2016

Neil Gee on how to add background images to widget areas using Customizer in Genesis.

Add background images to widget areas using Customizer in #GenesisWP https://t.co/tS7fmaGL1z

— Neil Gee (@_neilgee) March 19, 2016

…and Sridhar has some more thoughts on the same topic.

Related:https://t.co/qO7SgHM0JOhttps://t.co/QzLowShiwk#GenesisWP https://t.co/UVS6rJcNNH

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) March 25, 2016

Jackie D’Elia shows you how to add a SVG Logo to Carrie Dils’ Utility Pro theme.

Keeping it sharp – Adding a SVG Logo to Utility Pro theme. #GenesisWP #Sass #WordPress https://t.co/T2e6fiwQt0 via @jdelia

— Jackie D'Elia (@jdelia) March 20, 2016

Claire Brotherton with a tutorial on creating a custom homepage for the Genesis Framework.

A Custom Homepage For The Genesis Framework https://t.co/tXuVZb6Mj2 #WordPress #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/p5fGwHMNHM

— Claire Brotherton (@abrightclearweb) March 24, 2016

Shay Bocks with a tutorial on how to use static images in the hero area of her Brunch Pro theme.

New Tutorial: Using Static Images in the Hero Area with Brunch Pro https://t.co/9qsr80tZlC #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/dT04zN6u9e

— Shay Bocks (@shaybocks) March 23, 2016

Sridhar’s been busy as ever with new tutorials, including:

  • Featured Pages with Excerpts sliding up on Hover in Genesis
  • How to automatically display posts in a custom grid layout in Genesis
  • How to display full sized (viewport height) featured image on static Pages in Digital Pro
  • How to add an inline mobile responsive menu in Genesis Sample
  • How to get rid of the image logo in Genesis
  • How to add taxonomy slugs to entry terms span in Genesis
  • How to add Page slug as a body class for static Pages in WordPress
  • Full screen Soliloquy slider with widget overlay in Dynamik

How to add an inline mobile responsive menu in Genesis Sample: https://t.co/gC8fmtSGra#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/ePa6lfMuME

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) March 21, 2016

And Susan Ramsey is putting out Genesis blog posts at a prolific rate!

I've written four blog posts this week. That's some kind of record for me: https://t.co/aFpnnuWWti #Genesis4Beginners #GenesisWP

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) March 19, 2016

And finally…

Huge congrats to Lauren and the crew over at Restored 316 on celebrating eight years in business on 26 March!

And if you haven’t checked out the restored316designs.com website recently you really should. They keep raising the bar on their theme designs and their blog is consistently on point.

Go Lauren!
